intro: Sebastiania echinocarpa, commonly known as the spiked-seed sebastiania, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant produces small, spiky fruits that contain seeds coated in a sticky resin. Its leaves are typically alternate, simple, and have a rough texture. Sebastiania echinocarpa is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky areas.
